sentence.idiomatic: Is Mr. Li going to America on business? Yes.
He is not going to Britain to study.
What are you going to China to do? I am going to China to do business.
Have you heard it? Nope.
Ms. Li has not heard of the matter involving Mr. Zhang.
Where did you hear I am going to Britain? I heard it from Mr. Wang.
Chinese people like to eat and do business at the same time.
Do you like to eat while watching the television? I do.
Don't walk and read at the same time.
I like to spend some time to understand someone before becoming their friend.
What did you spend time doing before coming to work? I spent time doing morning exercises.
Ms. Wang does not like to spend time watching television. Mr. Wang also doesn't like to spend time watching television.
What does that mean?
That means that I'm going to go to the United States.
That doesn't mean you'll lose your job.
Ms. Li spends time interacting with her colleague.
Have you interacted with Mr. Zhang? Yes. I work with him.
Mr. Wang doesn't have any business with them.
Isn't that great?
Isn't taking a taxi quite fast?
Isn't business quite good?
To develop good relations requires a lot of contact.
We rely on ourselves.
Who do you rely on? I rely on my parents.
It is important that you understand me.
Is it important that he be able to speak English? Yes.
It isn't important that he doesn't know of this matter.
I can ensure that I'll do my job well.
Can you ensure that he will come? No.
What can you ensure? I can ensure that I'll arrive on time.
Please phone me before you come.
Before what time will he call? Before four o'clock.
Mr. Li ate breakfast before starting work.

word.literal: to have heard it said that

sentence.idiomatic: I’m going to China on a business trip next month. I’d heard that Chinese people like to do business while dining.

That’s right. In China business people spend time getting to know each other before doing business. That means that you will spend a lot of time talking business over dinner and socializing with your Chinese colleagues.
I see. But doesn’t that take a lot of time.
Yeah, it takes a lot of time, but it’s important. A lot of business in China is carried out through good relationships. It’s really important that you understand that point.
Okay. I’ll make sure to build a good relationship before talking business.

word.literal: to have heard it said that
